line_1: The Champion, who the gawdy Sylvan dares,
line_2: First by rude Din the sullen Beast prepares.

line_1: Warned by late peril now she scarcely dares
line_2: Sure in his sight, her soul of nought despairs,

line_1: Give it the Bard, who boldly dares
line_2: Who wisely checks, but not impairs

line_1: Without their leave, whose madness dares
line_2: Rouze human states to cruel wars;

line_1: The gen'rous sailor, he who dares
line_2: All forms of danger, while he bears

line_1: At length a bolder deed he dares;
line_2: He longs to go — but yet he fears;

line_1: Thee Forfar to the combat dares,
" All this he does, because he dares. "
Fix'd in the Front, the Foe he bravely dares,
line_2: Like PALLAS prudent, and as bold as MARS.
